alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:17AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sedgwick, Harvey and Butler Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 117 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Latham to Goddard. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Newton, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Goddard, Rose Hill, Hesston, Maize, Clearwater, Cheney, Halstead, North Newton and Douglass. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 43. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 34 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for south central and southeastern Kansas.
